turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: What do we -- the commission have probable cause.

turn.speaker: john_m_levy
turn.label: Mr. John M. Levy
turn.text: Correct.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Now, that's meaningless.

turn.speaker: john_m_levy
turn.label: Mr. John M. Levy
turn.text: It is not meaningless to the injured worker.
This order --

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: I know but if the employer relies on (Inaudible) but apparently it doesn’t affect the guy were involved.

turn.speaker: john_m_levy
turn.label: Mr. John M. Levy
turn.text: It affects legally before a court, a Circuit Court in Virginia that is a question of what the effect that is, but in actuality he suspect --

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Now you brought it up. [Laughter]

turn.speaker: john_m_levy
turn.label: Mr. John M. Levy
turn.text: One other response that I would like to make --

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Before you go to the response, aren’t you really asking some kind of a judicial command from someone, some court somewhere to keep up the payments until there has been a full adversary hearing?

turn.speaker: john_m_levy
turn.label: Mr. John M. Levy
turn.text: Yes, Your Honor.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: In other words sort of a specific performance, equity relief?

turn.speaker: john_m_levy
turn.label: Mr. John M. Levy
turn.text: We are asking that this Court say that Rule 13 does not provide due process by in reality terminates suspending benefits.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: As I understand Mr. Brame he said he is going to circuit court, you will get just that, we want the money ahead of time?

turn.speaker: john_m_levy
turn.label: Mr. John M. Levy
turn.text: We will get another judgment which is a ministerial act of the court which any insurance company will treat the same way as the judgment of the Commission.
And --

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: Do you mean the judgment -- do you mean there is no way in Virginia to enforce a judgment against the insurance company?

turn.speaker: john_m_levy
turn.label: Mr. John M. Levy
turn.text: Yes, there are the traditional common law remedies --

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: Well, I thought so.

turn.speaker: john_m_levy
turn.label: Mr. John M. Levy
turn.text: Yes attachment.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: So should they give another judgment?

turn.speaker: john_m_levy
turn.label: Mr. John M. Levy
turn.text: Correct, Your Honor.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: Well then the Court will give you what you want the Commission to give you, what would you want us to give you?

turn.speaker: john_m_levy
turn.label: Mr. John M. Levy
turn.text: No, Your Honor.
What --

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: Well, what do you want?
Do you want money in between the two hearings, right?

turn.speaker: john_m_levy
turn.label: Mr. John M. Levy
turn.text: We want a notice.
First of all the fact that there is --

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: Or is it, if you get your money, do you want a notice?

turn.speaker: john_m_levy
turn.label: Mr. John M. Levy
turn.text: No. [Laughter]

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: So you are asking us to order the company to pay you the money until they have the due process hearing?

turn.speaker: john_m_levy
turn.label: Mr. John M. Levy
turn.text: No.
What we --

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: Will you be satisfied with it?

turn.speaker: john_m_levy
turn.label: Mr. John M. Levy
turn.text: Certainly, but I don’t think --

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: Well, as I understand all you have to do is file a piece of paper at a court and you get just that?

turn.speaker: john_m_levy
turn.label: Mr. John M. Levy
turn.text: I think that is not clear in Virginia law.
Second of all, that does not solve the problem of notice.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: If you get the money?

turn.speaker: john_m_levy
turn.label: Mr. John M. Levy
turn.text: Yes, but you have to have, you have to go --

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: If you give me the money, I don’t care about the notice? [Laughter]

turn.speaker: john_m_levy
turn.label: Mr. John M. Levy
turn.text: No, but the filing of the Court -- the papers in the Court does not give you the money.
That is --

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: If you owe me money and you pay me money, you can even deny me due process, if you give me my money, am I right? [Laughter]

turn.speaker: john_m_levy
turn.label: Mr. John M. Levy
turn.text: The procedure is -- Yes, you are right. [Laughter]
No, I am sorry no that is, of course, not our position.
The procedures which in reality are, in effect, in Virginia show that benefits are paid, this goes to the voluntariness of the system.

If this is the position that is being required or would be required in the Court then you would have a procedure which would draw the Workmen’s Compensation system all out of quilters as the national commission on Workmen’s Compensation said.

The Industrial Commission of Virginia does not have “enforcement power” meaning that the State of Virginia setup their system so that the Commission would not go out and attach insurance company’s property.
They gave that that power or they left that power alone in the court and that is the only thing that Section 100 of the Code gives.
It’s just the very rare instance and the only litigation that could be found under that is 30 years old.
This is just leaving with the traditional common law of court, the power to garnishee, to attach property and all of that.

This system works under a voluntary system with penalties which are assessed against insurance companies for not paying when due with the ability of the state corporation commission to pull an insurance company's license if they are not meeting their obligation under this procedure.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: It sounds to me as though what you are doing is conceding that you have an adequate remedy at law, but it is too complicated and takes to long.
Therefore, you want something, you want a shortcut?

turn.speaker: john_m_levy
turn.label: Mr. John M. Levy
turn.text: No, by the very fact that it is complicated and takes too long, the plaintiffs in Goldberg had a procedure.
They could have gone in to Federal Court and enforced their welfare.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: But that was not a contractual case, was it?

turn.speaker: john_m_levy
turn.label: Mr. John M. Levy
turn.text: No.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
